comments.author: Steeley
comments.created_time: June 20, 2022, 08:30:19 PMLast edit: June 20, 2022, 08:43:42 PM by Steeley
comments.body: This device is amazing. Gotta get one. I had never thought about this before but the offline generation of keys made me realize a couple things that are interesting. First, 2256 is an unfathomable number of possibilities which means the likelihood of a duplicate is close to zero. Second, However, there is no safeguard against an actual duplicate even if the possibility is extremely unlikely. Set me straight if I am wrong. Also, I'm not a skeptic. Here is a video showing how likely it is to have a duplicate: https://youtu.be/S9JGmA5_unYSteeley
